devdoc.details: SimpleReadAccessController is not suitable for access controlling writes since it grants any externally owned account access! See SimpleWriteAccessController for that.

acceptOwnership().details: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

addAccess(address).notice: Adds an address to the access list

hasAccess(address,bytes).notice: Returns the access of an address

removeAccess(address).notice: Removes an address from the access list

userdoc.notice: Gives access to: - any externally owned account (note that offchain actors can always read any contract storage regardless of onchain access control measures, so this does not weaken the access control while improving usability) - accounts explicitly added to an access list
